class.rdfs:comment: A process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.
class.rdfs:label: MedicalProcedure

schema:bodyLocation.rdfs:comment: Location in the body of the anatomical structure.
schema:bodyLocation.rdfs:label: bodyLocation

schema:followup.rdfs:comment: Typical or recommended followup care after the procedure is performed.
schema:followup.rdfs:label: followup

schema:indication.rdfs:comment: A factor that indicates use of this therapy for treatment and/or prevention of a condition, symptom, etc. For therapies such as drugs, indications can include both officially-approved indications as well as off-label uses. These can be distinguished by using the ApprovedIndication subtype of MedicalIndication.
schema:indication.rdfs:label: indication

schema:outcome.rdfs:comment: Expected or actual outcomes of the study.
schema:outcome.rdfs:label: outcome

schema:preparation.rdfs:comment: Typical preparation that a patient must undergo before having the procedure performed.
schema:preparation.rdfs:label: preparation

schema:procedureType.rdfs:comment: The type of procedure, for example Surgical, Noninvasive, or Percutaneous.
schema:procedureType.rdfs:label: procedureType
